§ 21906. Headquarters and meetings The corporation may have its headquarters and hold its meetings at places the corporation decides are best. (Pub. L. 105–225, Aug. 12, 1998, 112 Stat. 1299.)
Historical and Revision Notes
RevisedSectionSource (U.S. Code)Source (Statutes at Large)
2190636:3306.July 5, 1935, ch. 373, § 6, 49 Stat. 458.
The word “may” is substituted for “be, and is hereby, authorized to” to eliminate unnecessary words. The words “within or without the District of Columbia” and “from time to time” are omitted as unnecessary.
